comments:
I had a fresh installed Eclipse 3.0 with some small plugins, nothing special and
updated to 3.0.1 using the integrated update of Eclipse.
All stuff (bin+conf+workspace) are located in "C:\Program Files\Eclipse3"

After successful (?) update I get the error message:
 An error has occurred. See the log file
 c:\Progam

The log file only shows as error:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Sep 21, 2004 13:35:29.492
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.RuntimeException: No application id has been found.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:313)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:273)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:129)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:183)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:644)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:628)

What do I need to do to recover my installation?
It seems to be broken due to the automatic update.

Nope, I do not agree. I have a different message.
I played around with the installed files (after archiving them...) - The IDE now
is able to come up if 
configuration\org.eclipse.update\platform.xml
is erased from disk prior starting.
Then a lot of other thisng do not work - but it look like the application fails
due some kind of update hook?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74377 ***

traces.message: No application id has been found.
